enrichment.summary: This executive order requires all federal agencies, including independent regulatory agencies, to be under tighter presidential supervision. It mandates that significant regulations be reviewed by the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs before publication to ensure accountability and consistent implementation of federal laws.
potential_concerns: Increased presidential control over independent agencies may undermine their statutory independence and affect regulatory objectivity.
Mandatory OIRA review of all significant regulations might slow down the regulatory process or reduce regulatory innovation.
Implementation may face legal challenges regarding separation of powers and agency autonomy.
Independent agencies may encounter difficulties balancing agency missions with new presidential priorities and restrictions.
Regular performance evaluations and budgetary controls could politicize agency functions and affect long-term policy consistency.
